org.stanwood.podcaster
Class PodCaster

java.lang.Object
  org.stanwood.podcaster.launcher.AbstractLauncher
      org.stanwood.podcaster.PodCaster

public class PodCaster
extends AbstractLauncher

This class provides a tool for capturing audio streams and storing them as podcasts. See the PodCaster.main(String[]) method for more details.

Method Summary

          The main method used to capture a stream to a audio file.

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The main method used to capture a stream to a audio file. The following command line syntax is passed to this method: 
 podcaster [-a <url>] [-c <string>] [-ed <string>] -f <format> [-fa
 <url>] [-fd <sting>] [-h] -i <string> [-l <arg>] [-m <number>] [-r
 <string>] -rf <file> -ru <URL> -t <msecs> -u <url>
 -a,--metaArtworkUrl <url>         Set the artwork to the URL
 -c,--metaCopyright <string>       Set the copyright meta data
 -ed,--entryDescription <string>   Description of the entry
 -f,--format <format>              Capture format (wav,mp3,mp4)
 -fa,--feedArtwork <url>           The URL to the feeds artwork
 -fd,--feedDescription <sting>     Description of the feed
 -h,--help                         Show the help
 -i,--metaTitle <string>           The title of the radio show
 -l,--log_config <arg>             The log config mode [<INFO>|<DEBUG>|<log4j config file>]
 -m,--maxEntries <number>          Maximum entries allowed in the feed,defaults to 20
 -r,--metaArtist <string>          Set the artist meta data
 -rf,--rssFile <file>              The location of the rss file
 -ru,--rssUrl <URL>                The public URL to the rss file
 -t,--time <msecs>                 Capture time (msecs)
 -u,--url <url>                    Radio url

This does the actual work of the tool.

Specified by:
